meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny!

I'm back with another review of Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2, because who doesn't love a good ol' skate fest? I mean, IGN thinks it's a "tremendous turnaround" from the previous disaster, and GameSpot says it nails the original experience. Yeah, yeah, yeah... let's get to the good stuff!

The game is a blast (pun intended)! The controls are silky smooth, the levels are lovingly designed, and the music is like a warm hug for your eardrums. I mean, what more could you ask for in a skateboarding game? Oh, and did I mention that the graphics look amazing? Yeah, it's like having a virtual Tony Hawk poster on your wall (minus the possibility of getting splattered with bird poop).

Now, some critics might say that the game is just too easy or that there aren't enough level goals. But honestly, who doesn't love a good combo fest? And besides, the lack of level goals only encourages you to try new things and experiment with different tricks.

I do agree with Game Informer that this remaster feels fresh and current, despite being an old-school classic. The challenge system is engaging, and the multiplayer option is a nice addition (even if I didn't get too far in it).

Gaming Age thinks this remaster does an excellent job of retaining the spirit of the originals while adding new features and music. And, honestly, I think they're right on the money! It's like Activision and Vicarious Visions took all our favorite memories from the old games and polished them up to perfection.

Now, some folks might say that this game is a bit light on content or that there aren't enough new features to justify the price. But honestly, I think it's a small price to pay for such an amazing remaster. And besides, who doesn't love re-experiencing their childhood favorites?

So, what's the verdict? Well, let's just say that Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2 is a title that will make you wanna grab your board and hit the pavement (or at least, play it for hours on end).

That's all for now! If you're ready to relive some skateboarding magic or experience it for the first time, then this remaster is definitely worth checking out!
